thread.title: Why Fund-Flow Stats Aren’t the Indicator They Used to Be

author: Simon Constable
title: Why Fund-Flow Stats Aren’t the Indicator They Used to Be
text:
Smart investors used to be able to identify market tops and bottoms by watching the weekly flows of money into and out of mutual funds.
Then came the stampede into exchange-traded funds, and the crystal ball for predicting market shifts grew cloudy.
Because weekly flow data now measures not just money moving into or out of mutual funds or... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
